thread.title: Small business executive program taking applications spring
thread.title_full: Small business executive program taking applications for spring - Sun Sentinel

author: Marcia Heroux Pounds
title: Small business executive program taking applications spring
text:
The Jim Moran Institute for Global Entrepreneurship program in the Florida State University College of Business is accepting applications through Oct. 20 for the South Florida division's spring 2016 Small Business Executive Program.
The program is free to participants and is designed for leaders of small businesses and nonprofit organizations to give them the skills to turn challenges into strategic advantages.
Applicants must be involved in running a business that's a least two years old and has three or more employees.
The Small Business Executive Program is offered twice a year with 25 participants each session.
The spring program is scheduled to begin the evening of Jan. 25, with an orientation and opening reception. The first training session starts the next day. The program includes nine sessions from 8:30 a.m. to 2 p.m. every other Tuesday through May 17 at various South Florida locations.
Since the program's launch in January 2013, 150 business owners and nonprofit chief executives have participated in the program.
For more information about the Small Business Executive Program and The Jim Moran Institute's South Florida services, contact Jennifer Brin Kovach at jkovach@business.fsu.edu, 954-228-3082 or visit sfl.jmi.fsu.edu .
mpounds@tribpub.com or 561-243-6650
 Florida State University
